channel.title: CVE Feed for Adobe -- Flash Player
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Adobe -- Flash Player

item.title: CVE-2019-8069|2024-08-04T21:10:32.611Z -- adobe -- flash%20player
item.description: Adobe Flash Player 32.0.0.238 and earlier versions, 32.0.0.207 and earlier versions have a Same Origin Method Execution vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to Arbitrary Code Execution in the context of the current user.

item.title: CVE-2019-8070|2024-08-04T21:10:32.563Z -- adobe -- flash%20player
item.description: Adobe Flash Player 32.0.0.238 and earlier versions, 32.0.0.207 and earlier versions have a Use after free vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to Arbitrary Code Execution in the context of the current user.

item.title: CVE-2020-9746|2024-08-04T10:43:04.974Z -- adobe -- flash%20player
item.description: Adobe Flash Player version 32.0.0.433 (and earlier) are affected by an exploitable NULL pointer dereference vulnerability that could result in a crash and arbitrary code execution. Exploitation of this issue requires an attacker to insert malicious strings in an HTTP response that is by default delivered over TLS/SSL.

item.title: CVE-2019-8075|2024-08-04T21:10:32.610Z -- adobe -- flash%20player
item.description: Adobe Flash Player version 32.0.0.192 and earlier versions have a Same Origin Policy Bypass vulnerability. Successful exploitation could lead to Information Disclosure in the context of the current user.
